00039 /**
00040 * @file fifo.h
00041 * @date 2008/05/11 16:13
00042 * @author Sergio Montenegro, Lutz Dittrich
00043 *
00044 * Copyright 2008 DLR
00045 *
00046 * @brief FIFO (first in first out) communication (header)
00047 *
00048 */

00050 #pragma once
00051 
00052 #include "putter.h"
00053 
00054 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00055 namespace RODOS {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 /**
00059 *  @class Fifo
00060 *  @brief simple FIFO (realized as ring buffer)
00061 *
00062 *  A fifo where both sides (reader & writer) can work asynchronously.
00063 *  If one side has more than one owner, the fifo has to be
00064 *  protected using priority_ceiling, or semaphores.
00065 *
00066 *  @param Type    data type of fifo entries
00067 *  @param len     maximal number of entries must be at least 2
00068 *
00069 */
00070 template < typename Type, int len > class Fifo : public Putter {
00071 
00072 protected:
00073 
00074     Type buffer[len];
00075 
00076     volatile int writeX;
00077     volatile int readX;
00078 
00079     /** advance index to next position
00080     * with overflow to 0 to implement a ring
00081     */
00082     int advanceIndex(int index) {
00083         return ((index < (len-1)) ? (index+1) : 0);
00084     }
00085 
00086 
00087 public:
00088 
00089     Fifo() {
00090         readX = 0;
00091         writeX = 0;
00092     }
00093 
00094     /** implements the generic interface of putter */
00095     bool putGeneric(const long topicId, const unsigned int msgLen, const void* msg, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo) {
00096         if(msgLen > sizeof(Type)) {
00097             ERROR("fifo wrong len");
00098             return false;
00099         }
00100         return put(*(Type*)msg);
00101     }
00102 
00103     /**  returns true == ok, false == fifo full */
00104     bool put(const Type& val) {
00105         int index =  advanceIndex(writeX);
00106         if(index == readX) {
00107             return false; /* full! */
00108         }
00109 
00110         buffer[writeX] = val;
00111         writeX = index;
00112         return true;
00113     }
00114 
00115     /** return true == ok, false = fifo empty, val not modified */
00116     bool get(Type& val) {
00117         if(readX == writeX) {
00118             return false;
00119         }
00120         val = buffer[readX];
00121         readX = advanceIndex(readX);
00122         return true;
00123     }
00124 
00125     int getLen() { return len; }
00126 
00127     int getElementCount() { ///< warning: not absolutelly threadsafe
00128         int r = readX;
00129         int w = writeX;
00130         return (r <= w) ? (w-r) : (len-r+w);
00131     }
00132     int getFreeSpaceCount() { ///< warning: not absolutelly threadsafe
00133         return len - getElementCount() - 1;
00134     }
00135     bool isFull()  { return advanceIndex(writeX)==readX; } ///< warning: not absolutelly threadsafe
00136     bool isEmpty() { return readX == writeX;}              ///< warning: not absolutelly threadsafe
00137 };

00141 /**
00142 * @class SyncFifo
00143 * @brief A synchronized fifo.
00144 *
00145 * Like Fifo, but it provides syncPut which block if the fifo is
00146 * full and syncRead which block if the fifo is empty.
00147 * Each function may have a timeout. If no timeout is given, or timeout == 0
00148 * it will wait util the fifo is not empty/full.
00149 * Warning:
00150 * Only for one writer and one reader. If more than that is required it has
00151 * to be protected using semaphores.
00152 *
00153 */
00154 template <class Type, int len> class SyncFifo : public Fifo<Type, len> {
00155 
00156 protected:
00157     Thread* suspendedReader;
00158     Thread* suspendedWriter;
00159 
00160 public:
00161 
00162     SyncFifo() {
00163         suspendedReader = 0;
00164         suspendedWriter = 0;
00165     }
00166 
00167 
00168     /**
00169     * Implements the generic interface of putter:
00170     * Warning does not suspends if fifo full
00171     */
00172     bool putGeneric(const long topicId, const unsigned int msgLen, const void* msg, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo) {
00173         if (msgLen > sizeof(Type)) {
00174             ERROR("syncFifo wrong len");
00175             return false;
00176         }
00177 
00178         bool ok = this->put(*(Type*)msg);
00179         PRIORITY_CEILING {
00180             if (suspendedReader!=0) {
00181                 suspendedReader->resume();
00182             }
00183         }
00184         return ok;
00185     }
00186 
00187     /**  suspends while fifo is full. returns true == ok, false == timeout, */
00188     bool syncPut(Type &val, const int64_t timeout = 0) {
00189         bool ok = false;
00190         PRIORITY_CEILING {
00191             ok = this->put(val);
00192             if (!ok) {
00193                 suspendedWriter =       Thread::getCurrentThread();
00194                 if (timeout == 0) {
00195                     Thread::suspendCallerUntil(END_OF_TIME);
00196                 } else  {
00197                     Thread::suspendCallerUntil(NOW() + timeout);
00198                 }
00199                 suspendedWriter = 0; // after suspend, after resume
00200             }
00201         }
00202 
00203         if (!ok) { ok = this->put(val); }
00204 
00205         if (ok) {
00206             PRIORITY_CEILING {
00207                 if(suspendedReader) {
00208                     suspendedReader->resume();
00209                 }
00210             }
00211         }
00212         return ok;
00213     }
00214 
00215     /** return true == ok, false = fifo empty, val not modified */
00216     int syncGet(Type &val, const int64_t timeout = 0) {
00217         bool ok = false;
00218         PRIORITY_CEILING {
00219             ok= this->get(val);
00220             if (!ok) {
00221                 suspendedReader = Thread::getCurrentThread();
00222                 if(timeout == 0) {
00223                     Thread::suspendCallerUntil(END_OF_TIME);
00224                 } else {
00225                     Thread::suspendCallerUntil(NOW() + timeout);
00226                 }
00227                 suspendedReader = 0;
00228             }
00229         }
00230 
00231         if (!ok) { ok = this->get(val); }
00232 
00233         if(ok) {
00234             PRIORITY_CEILING {
00235                 if (suspendedWriter) {
00236                     suspendedWriter->resume();
00237                 }
00238             }
00239         }
00240         return ok;
00241     }
00242 
00243 };

00246 template <typename Type, int len, int numOfreaders >
00247 class MultipleReaderFifo : public Putter {
00248 
00249 protected:
00250 
00251     Type buffer[len];
00252 
00253     volatile int writeX;
00254     volatile int readX[numOfreaders];
00255     unsigned int readerCnt; ///< used only to genereate readerId, if user wisches!
00256 
00257     /** advance index to next position
00258     * with overflow to 0 to implement a ring
00259     */
00260     int advanceIndex(int index) {
00261         return ((index < (len-1)) ? (index+1) : 0);
00262     }
00263 
00264 
00265 public:
00266 
00267     MultipleReaderFifo() {
00268         readerCnt = 0;
00269         writeX = 0;
00270         for(int i = 0; i < numOfreaders; i++) readX[i] = 0;
00271     }
00272 
00273     int getReaderId() { //< Warning: not threade safe!!!
00274         int myId = readerCnt++;
00275         if(myId > numOfreaders) return -1; // no more readers!
00276         return myId;
00277     }
00278 
00279     /** implements the generic interface of putter */
00280     bool putGeneric(const long topicId, const unsigned int msgLen, const void* msg, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo) {
00281         if(msgLen > sizeof(Type)) {
00282             ERROR("fifo wrong len");
00283             return false;
00284         }
00285         return put(*(Type*)msg);
00286     }
00287 
00288     /**  returns true == ok, false == fifo full */
00289     bool put(const Type& val) {
00290         int index =  advanceIndex(writeX);
00291         for(int i = 0; i < numOfreaders; i++) {
00292             if(index == readX[i]) { // one reading is to slow -> shift him!
00293                 readX[i] = advanceIndex(readX[i]); // Warnign: thread safe?!?!
00294             }
00295         }
00296 
00297         buffer[writeX] = val;
00298         writeX = index;
00299         return true;
00300     }
00301 
00302     /** return true == ok, false = fifo empty, val not modified */
00303     bool get(Type& val, int readerId) {
00304         if(readerId >= numOfreaders)  return false;
00305         if(readX[readerId] == writeX) return false;
00306 
00307         val = buffer[readX[readerId]];
00308         readX[readerId] = advanceIndex(readX[readerId]);
00309         return true;
00310     }
00311 
00312     ///
00313     int getLen() { return len; }
00314 };
00315 
00316 
00317 /**
00318   * A Fifo that lets you write or read continius Blocks of the stored type.
00319   * Gives out pointers to the internal space, so you can copy data directly from/to there.
00320   * Useful for DMA trasnfers.
00321   */
00322 
00323 template <class Type, int len>  class BlockFifo : public Fifo<Type,len> {
00324 protected:
00325     int advanceIndexEx(int index,int advanceSize) {
00326         int newIndex = index + advanceSize;
00327         while(newIndex >= len) {
00328             newIndex -= len;
00329         }
00330         return newIndex;
00331     }
00332 
00333 
00334 public:
00335     BlockFifo() { }
00336 
00337 
00338     /// returns pointer to write and maximal number of entries you may write
00339     Type* getBufferToWrite(int& maxLen) {
00340         int r = this->readX;
00341         int w = this->writeX;
00342 
00343         if(r == this->advanceIndex(w)) { //full
00344             maxLen =0;
00345             return 0;
00346         }
00347 
00348         if(r > w) { // put till r-1 possible
00349             maxLen = r - w - 1;
00350         } else { // put unitil end of buffer possible
00351             maxLen = len - w;
00352             if(r == 0) { maxLen--; }
00353         }
00354         return &(this->buffer[w]);
00355     }
00356 
00357     /// call this after you have written in the buffer you got from getBufferToWrite
00358     void writeConcluded(int numOfWrittenElements) {
00359         this->writeX = advanceIndexEx(this->writeX, numOfWrittenElements);
00360     }
00361 
00362     // returns pointer to read and maximal number of entries you may read
00363     Type* getBufferToRead(int& maxLen) {
00364         int r = this->readX;
00365         int w = this->writeX;
00366 
00367         if(r == w) { //empty
00368             maxLen =0;
00369             return 0;
00370         }
00371 
00372         if(r < w) { // get till w-1 possible
00373             maxLen = w - r;
00374         } else { // get unitil end of buffer possible
00375             maxLen = len - r;
00376         }
00377         return &(this->buffer)[r];
00378     }
00379 
00380     /// call this after you have read in the buffer you got from getBufferToRead
00381     void readConcluded(int sizeRed) {
00382         this->readX=advanceIndexEx(this->readX,sizeRed);
00383     }
00384 
00385 };
00386

00389 }
